activity.activityName: electricity production, photovoltaic, 3kWp slanted-roof installation, multi-Si, panel, mounted
activity.includedActivitiesStart: From the PV module installed and ready to be used.
activity.includedActivitiesEnd:
This activity ends with low voltage electricity produced with the 3 kWp module, assuming an average yield.
This dataset includes tap water use for cleaning the module and itâ€™s treatment.

generalComment.text: This dataset represents the production of grid-connected low voltage electricity with a 3 kWp building integrated photovoltaic (PV) module in Italy in 2012. The 3 kWp module has been chosen as basic module for building integrated PV electricity production. Larger modules can easily be built with these 3 kWp modules without producing a significant error in environmental impact calculations. The module is a multi-Si panel installed on a slanted roof.
An inverter is used to convert the low voltage DC power into AC power.
[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

comment.text: Electricity production with a grid-connected 3 kWp multi-Si photovoltaic panel mounted on a buildings slanted roof. See field "extrapolation" for comment on the output voltage.
The annual production volume valid for 2012

property.name: price
property.comment: Temporary price data. Calculated as 90% of purchasers price based on: IEA Key world energy statistics 2004 (www.iea.org/textbase/nppdf/free/2004/keyworld2004.pdf)

intermediateExchange.name: photovoltaic slanted-roof installation, 3kWp, multi-Si, panel, mounted, on roof
intermediateExchange.comment: Calculated value. Lifetime*capacity*annual yield = y * kWp/unit * kWh/(kWp*y) = kWh/unit and then the reciproke.

classification.classificationValue: 87360: Installation services of electrical machinery and apparatus n.e.c.

intermediateExchange.name: tap water
intermediateExchange.comment: Calculated value. Amount of installation needed to produce 1 kWh * panel area per installation * water need to clean 1 m2 of panel. [unit/kWh * m2/unit * l/m2 = l/kWh]. A density of 1 kg/dm3 is assumed.

property.name: carbon content, fossil
property.comment: Bicarbonate content is 2.93 mol/m3. CO2 content is 0.1 mol/m3 (ecoinvent v2.2 report 8, Tab 93.1).

property.name: dry mass
property.comment: Mineral content was estimated using the chemical properties of tap water in ecoinvent v2.2 report 8, Tab 93.1.

property.name: carbon content, non-fossil
property.comment: 0.0673 kg TOC/m3 (Tab A.17, ecoinvent v2.2 report 13_I). TOC was considered as Total Carbon.

property.name: dry mass
property.comment: The addition of compounds in water, listed in Tab A.17-20 from ecoinvent v2.2 report 13_I, has been used as an estimate of dry mass is wastewater. In this case, elementary composition has been expressed as molecular composition, whenever possible. This approach has been used when the addition of compunds in wastewater was bigger than the minimal mineral content estimated using the chemical properties of tap water in ecoinvent v2.2 report 8, Tab 93.1.

property.name: price
property.comment: Waste products are assigned a price of zero as they are assumed to require further treatment.

property.name: wet mass
property.comment: Density of water was assumed that of tap water 1kg/L, that is 1000kg/m3.

elementaryExchange.name: Water
elementaryExchange.comment: Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres" comment field.

property.name: fraction, origin: fresh water
property.comment: This property represent the fraction of the amount of the exchange which origin is fresh water.

property.name: fraction, origin: salt water
property.comment: This property represent the fraction of the amount of the exchange which origin is salt water.

property.name: fraction, origin: unspecified
property.comment: This property represent the fraction of the amount of the exchange which origin is unspecified.

elementaryExchange.name: Energy, solar, converted
elementaryExchange.comment: Energy loss in the system is included.

parameter.name: Panel area for one 3 kWp unit, mc-Si
parameter.comment: Literature value. Jungbluth N., Stucki M., Flury K., Frischknecht R. and Buesser S. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Photovoltaic Power Production. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, CH, retrieved from: www.esu-services.ch/data/public-lci-reports/ Tab. 12.3, p.127 nan

parameter.name: Share 3kWp slanted-roof installation, multi-Si, panel, mounted, on roof
parameter.comment:
Literature values, calculated value. Calculated from the shares of different types of cells in 2008 (European Photovoltaic Technology Platform 2012) and the shares of different types of mounting systems (Jungbluth et al. 2012). The latter shares are valid for Europe (RER) and do not take into account open ground PV plants. Due to lack of data for other regions or even countries on the world, the shares have been taken as calculation basis for all PV datasets.Further, the electricity markets in ecoinvent v3.2 are modelled with only three types of PV panels: multi-Si and single-Si panels installed at slanted roofs and open ground installations. The shares of the two slanted-roof installations are calculated based on the two sources mentioned before and amount to 44.5% (single-Si) and 55.5% (multi-Si), respectively (if no open ground present). Further, data from the IEA-PVPS 2013 were used to find out if there are any open ground installations present in a country. In some cases no or only aggregated information were given in the 2013 report, so that the report from 2014 was used in these cases with data for the year 2013. Where no information were given at all, no open ground installations are considered due to lack of data.
Sources: - European Photovoltaic Technology Platform. 2012. Photovoltaic Fact Sheets. The status of the PV industry (2008). LB-32-10-251-EN-D. retrieved from <http://www.eupvplatform.org/publications/misperceptions-fact-sheets.html#c2242> (accessed 31.01.2012) - Jungbluth N., Stucki M., Flury K., Frischknecht R. and Buesser S. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Photovoltaic Power Production. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, CH, retrieved from: www.esu-services.ch/data/public-lci-reports - IEA-PVPS. 2013. Trends 2013 in photovoltaic applications. Survey report of selected IEA countries between 1992 and 2012. International Energy Agency, Photovoltaic Power Systems Programme. Report IEA-PVPS T1-23:2013 - IEA-PVPS. 2014. Trends 2014 in photovoltaic applications. Survey report of selected IEA countries between 1992 and 2014. International Energy Agency, Photovoltaic Power Systems Programme. Report IEA-PVPS T1-23:2013 - annual production volumes in ecoinvent v3.2, photovoltaic datasets for electricity production.

parameter.name: Yield (Output), photovoltaics
parameter.comment:
Literature value/calculated value. Specific solar yield in kWh per kilowatt peak installed (radiation intensity and sunshine duration standardised to a default 1kW peak of capacity). The yield is taken from an IEA PVPS report valid for 2012, which presents data for one or several cities in a country for roof-top and faÃ§ade installations. The two values for one city were averaged based on the weight of the shares of these two installation types as presented in Jungbluth et al. 2012 (12.5% faÃ§ade installations, 87.5% roof-top installations, data valid for Europe). Data for several cities were just averaged without weighting. This dataset: Data from Rome and Milan
IEA PVPS. 2014. Compared assessment of selected environmental indicators of photovoltaic electricity in OECD cities. International Energy Agency - Photovoltaic Power Systems Programme. Jungbluth N., Stucki M., Flury K., Frischknecht R., BÃ¼sser S. 2012. Life Cycle Inventories of Photovoltaics. Report prepared for the Swiss Federal Office of Energy. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland. nan

parameter.name: Yield (Output), photovoltaics, corrected
parameter.comment: Estimated value. The annual yield is corrected with a correction factor of 0.92 according to Jungbluth et al. 2012. Annual output (yield), roof-top [kWh* kWp-1*y-1] The annual yield is corrected with a correction factor of 0.92 according to [ Jungbluth N., Stucki M., and Frischknecht R. (2009) Photovoltaics. In Dones, R. (Ed.) et al., Sachbilanzen von Energiesystemen: Grundlagen fÃ¼r den Ã¶kologischen Vergleich von Energiesystemen und den Einbezug von Energiesystemen in Oekobilanzen fÃ¼r die Schweiz. ecoinvent report No. 6-XII, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, DÃ¼bendorf, CH, 2009.]

parameter.name: capacity
parameter.comment: Capacity of the photovoltaic cell in MWp per installation unit [MWp/unit] nan

parameter.name: correction factor
parameter.comment: Estimation. Literature data on the yield for optimum installation and not real performance in the country have been corrected with a factor of 92% according to experiences in Switzerland for average production. This is based on the ratio of actual yield and published IEA data (820/892 = 0.92 - see Jungbluth et al. 2012 for detailed discussion) for use when something has to be corrected with an overall factor

parameter.name: fraction, process water, to air
parameter.comment: Literature value. In case when no industry/process specific data are available, default evaporation fraction value is used. This value is 15% and is based on literature (Statistics Canada, 2007 & Shaffer, K.H., 2008, Consumptive water use in the Great Lakes Basin, USGS & Shiklomanov, 2003, World Water Resources at the Beginning of the 21st Century) and has been approved by an expert. nan

parameter.name: fraction, tap water, to air
parameter.comment: Calculated value. See comment in the other parametres present in this dataset. Tap water is considered to be always used as process water, thus process water fractions to air are applied to all tap water input flows to calculate the amount of water consumed in the processes. nan

parameter.name: gross electricity production
parameter.comment:
Literature value/statistics. Total gross grid-connected photovoltaic electricity production in 2012 in this geography. For all OECD countries, data were taken from the OECD iLibrary 2014. For all non-OECD countries and the world, data were taken from IEA online statistics.
OECD. 2014. IEA Electricity Information Statistics: OECD - Electricity and heat generation. OECD iLibrary. Online database. DOI : 10.1787/elect-data-en IEA. 2014. Online statistics, Electricity and Heat for 2012. Retreived from http://www.iea.org/statistics/statisticssearch/report/?country=WORLD&product=electricityandheat&year=2012

parameter.name: lifetime
parameter.comment: Oral communication. Gnos, S. 2002. Personal Communication, 10.2002. NET AG, Switzerland nan

parameter.name: losses from gross electricity production
parameter.comment: Estimation. The factor for the loss of electricity from gross to net electricity production is an assumption based on experiences and expertise (5% losses for photovoltaics). nan

parameter.name: water use for cleaning photovoltaic panels

representativeness.extrapolations: LCI data represent specific production and manufacturing facilities (see published source).
